title: Eliminating Reflective Surfaces
brief: Remove or cover all shiny surfaces that could reflect light and reveal your position.
steps: Step 1: Cover shiny equipment spots with mud, paint, cloth, or tape.
Step 2: Pay special attention to boot eyelets, buckles, watches, jewelry, zippers, insignia.
Step 3: Apply thin layer of dust to outside of eyeglass lenses to reduce reflection.
Step 4: Carry signal mirror in pouch or pocket with mirror facing toward body.
Step 5: Cover glass objects like binoculars and telescopes when not in use.
Step 6: Wash oily skin frequently and reapply camouflage.
Step 7: Check all surfaces in buddy teams to identify missed shiny spots.
warnings: Any shine automatically attracts attention and gives away location.
Skin oils increase shine - regular washing is essential.
Even painted smooth surfaces may reflect light.
Glass objects can be seen from great distances when they catch light.
source: FM21-76_SurvivalManual.pdf — US Army Survival Manual (Chapter 21 - Camouflage)
